intro: Cynomarathrum brandegeei, commonly known as the Brandegee's ghost flower, is a rare and unique plant native to specific regions of California. It is a flowering plant in the Apiaceae family, characterized by its delicate, pale blue or white flowers that resemble ghostly apparitions. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
